content.question: Kersaint and Saint-Maurice’s arguments about granting citizenship to the Black inhabitants of Saint-Domingue are most different from the arguments of those nationalists who claimed that

choices.label: having a shared language and religion were more important than sharing a contiguous territory in determining who could be citizens within the nation
only those born within the territory of the nation and those who shared a common historical origin should be included as citizens within the nation
political power could only be exercised through the popular will of the nation’s citizens
people from separate national groups with distinct cultural traditions could be equal citizens within the same state

content.answer: only those born within the territory of the nation and those who shared a common historical origin should be included as citizens within the nation
